title: Where mountains float: A Greenland story
creator_credit: Arno Studio, Government Film Committee of Denmark and Bjarne Henning-Jensen
brief_description: Through events in the life of 10 year-old Mikisoq, an eskimo boy living with his family in a remote Greenland settlement, we see how a new Greenland is emerging with the involvement of Denmark. The heavy decrease in seal catches imposes poverty and hardship and the film shows how Mikisoq and his family eventually find a different life and future in a southern town. Grandfather prefers to stay behind.
